snippet: The release of Apple's new maps app was met with such furor that the company's chief executive even apologized for it. Still, the flawed maps are not turning people off from wanting the phone. A new survey estimates that as many as one-third of...
abstract: The release of Apple's new maps app was met with such furor that the company's chief executive even apologized for it. Still, the flawed maps are not turning people off from wanting the phone. A new survey estimates that as many as one-third of American shoppers are interested in getting the smartphone in the future.

headline.main: Despite Maps Debacle, Demand for New iPhone Appears Strong
